item.title: 3. Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
item.description: LeetCode problem Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters. Example 1: Input: s = "abcabcbb" Output: 3 Explanation: The answer is "abc", with the length of 3. First accepted Idea: Loop through string Calculate max count of elements in substring If get double element, then go back until get this element and do step 2. Proceed the main loop class Solution: def lengthOfLongestSubstring(self, s: str) -> int: uniqs = set() len_max = 0 len_current = 0 idx = 0 for i in s: if i in uniqs: len_max = max(len_max, len_current) len_current = 1 uniqs = set(i) for j in reversed(s[:idx]): if j == i: break else: len_current += 1 uniqs.

item.title: 643. Maximum Average Subarray I
item.description: LeetCode problem Problem Statement Given an integer array nums consisting of n elements and an integer k, find a contiguous subarray whose length is equal to k that has the maximum average value and return this value. The result must be accurate up to a decimal point of 10^(-5). Naive Solution A straightforward approach would be to calculate the average for every possible subarray of length k. For each starting point, sum the next k numbers and determine the average.
